member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.Core.TableViewSettings.IsParentInFrontForColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether parent for columns is in front of its children.
member.value: true if parent is in front of children; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
If set to true, the query set sorts members in a level in their natural order. Their natural order is the default ordering of the members along the hierarchy when no other sort conditions are specified. Child members immediately follow their parent members.
If set to false, the query set sorts the members in a level using a post-natural order. In other words, child members precede their parents.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.Core.TableViewSettings.IsParentInFrontForRows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether parent for rows is in front of its children.
member.value: true if parent is in front of children; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
If set to true, the query set sorts members in a level in their natural order. Their natural order is the default ordering of the members along the hierarchy when no other sort conditions are specified. Child members immediately follow their parent members.
If set to false, the query set sorts the members in a level using a post-natural order. In other words, child members precede their parents.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.Core.TableViewSettings.CompactColumnHeaders
member.summary:

true if the the headers should be arranged for compact layout; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource
member.summary: Base class for OLAP (Online Analytical Processing) data sources.

remarks.p: The OlapDataSource class is an abstract class which defines the interface through which a data consumer (such as the UltraPivotGrid control) communicates with an OLAP data server.
Because communication with an OLAP server is accomplished through client requests and server responses, most of the methods exposed by this class, and derived classes, are asynchronous in nature.

Many of the asynchronous methods exposed by this class follows a design pattern that makes it possible for the consumer to easily obtain data from the OLAP server, without the need for a complicated multi-threaded consumer implementation. The main features of this pattern are as follows:
A naming convention which suffixes all applicable methods with the phrase 'Async'.
An event which fires after the server responds to the request.
An optional parameter which provides the ability to specify whether the server request should be sent immediately, or deferred until the data source is updated manually.
An optional parameter which provides the ability to specify the thread on which the server raises this event.
A separate event which occurs when an exception is thrown by the server during processing of a request.

For example, consider the ExpandAxisTupleMemberAsync method. The first three method parameters allow the caller to specify the axis on which the member resides, the index of the tuple containing the member to expand, and the index of the member to expand, respectively.

Setting the value of the 'update' parameter to false allows the caller to defer the update until the UpdateAsync method is called. This provides a way to perform 'batch' style updating, where more than one change is made to the data source, with the multiple changes being applied later, as one atomic operation.

When true is specified as the value of the 'update' parameter, the request is dispatched to the OLAP server immediately. If, during processing of the request, an exception is thrown, the DataSourceError event occurs, reporting the error to listeners.

If the request is processed successfully, and the value of the 'update' parameter is set to true, the ExpandAxisTupleMemberAsyncCompleted event occurs, notifying listeners that the operation has been completed.

Notifications received from the OLAP server are dispatched on a background thread. Because Windows Forms controls are not thread safe, attempting to access properties or methods exposed by the control directly from within the contents of the event handler can cause a cross-thread exception to occur. The 'control' parameter provides a way for the developer to direct these notifications to the same thread as the one on which the control's handle was created. This eliminates the need for the listener to marshal the notification across thread boundaries, further simplifying the client implementation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.Timeout
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time for which an inactive asynchronous operation will wait before throwing an exception.

remarks.p: When an asynchronous task is executed, the amount of time it takes to process the request is dependent on various factors, such as current server load, server processor capabilities, network bandwidth, etc.
If an asynchronous task spends more time in the 'waiting for activation' state than is allowed by the value of this property, a TimeoutException is thrown.

member.summary: VerifyCancel

member.name: M:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.CancelUpdate
member.summary: Cancels any currently executing asynchronous operation.

remarks.p: Calling this method causes an AsyncOperationCanceledException to be thrown, which is caught and propagated to listeners via the DataSourceError event.
Operations for which an update was canceled are not recorded as PendingChanges.
In the case where the UpdateAsync method is canceled, any remaining uncommitted pending changes are discarded.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.GetHierarchyMembersAsync(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Sends a request to the OLAP server for a list of the members which belong to the specified Hierarchy, and raises the GetHierarchyMembersAsyncCompleted event when the server sends the response.
member.param: The unique name of the Hierarchy whose members are to be retrieved.

Optional reference to a Control. If specified, the GetHierarchyMembersAsyncCompleted event is raised on the thread on which this control's handle was created. This approach makes it possible to access control members directly from the event handler.

remarks.p: This method returns immediately after issuing the request to the OLAP server so as not to block the calling thread. The actual list of members, however, is not available until the server returns this request, which happens indeterminately.

member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the member was found.

remarks.p: This method returns immediately after issuing the request to the OLAP server so as not to block the calling thread. The actual initialization, however, is not complete until the server signifies completion, which happens indeterminately.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.SetCubeAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Sends an asynchronous request to the OLAP server to set the specified cube as the data source's current cube.
member.param: The name of the cube to which the data source's current cube is to be set.

param.name: update
param.p: Optional boolean value indicating whether to update the data source immediately.
The default value is true, which causes the request to be sent to the OLAP server immediately, and raises the GetCubesAsyncCompleted event when the server's response has been received.
If false is specified, the request is not sent to the server until the UpdateAsync method is called.
Note that when false is specified, the GetCubesAsyncCompleted event does not occur.

member.param: Optional reference to a Control. If specified, the GetCubesAsyncCompleted event is raised on the thread on which this control's handle was created. This approach makes it possible to access control members directly from the event handler.

remarks.p: The data source's cube, sometimes referred to as a 'hypercube' or 'datacube', defines the set of hierarchies and measures that are available to the consumer.

Changing the data source's currently selected cube triggers re-initialization of the data source.Any previously defined hierarchies and measures are no longer valid, so any cached information that references hierarchies or measures defined by the previously selected cube should be refreshed after calling this method.

This method returns immediately after issuing the request to the OLAP server so as not to block the calling thread. The actual operation, however, does not occur until the server returns this request, which happens indeterminately.

member.summary: Sends an asynchronous request to the OLAP server to expand the specified axis tuple member.
member.param: Identifies the axis to which the tuple member belongs, i.e., the row or column axis.
The index of the tuple to expand.
The index of the member to expand.

param.name: update
param.p: Optional boolean value indicating whether to update the data source immediately.
The default value is true, which causes the request to be sent to the OLAP server immediately, and raises the ExpandAxisTupleMemberAsyncCompleted event when the server's response has been received.
If false is specified, the request is not sent to the server until the UpdateAsync method is called.
Note that when false is specified, the ExpandAxisTupleMemberAsyncCompleted event does not occur.

member.param: Optional reference to a Control. If specified, the ExpandAxisTupleMemberAsyncCompleted event is raised on the thread on which this control's handle was created. This approach makes it possible to access control members directly from the event handler.

remarks.p: If the specified member is not expandable, or is currently expanded, this method returns without incident.

This method returns immediately after issuing the request to the OLAP server so as not to block the calling thread. The actual expansion, however, does not occur until the server returns this request, which happens indeterminately.

member.param: Optional reference to a Control. If specified, the RemoveAllFilterMembersAsyncCompleted event is raised on the thread on which this control's handle was created. This approach makes it possible to access control members directly from the event handler.

remarks.p: This method removes a member from the list of filter members that will appear in the column axis.

This method returns immediately after issuing the request to the OLAP server so as not to block the calling thread. The actual filtering operation, however, does not occur until the server returns this request, which happens indeterminately.

Note that when false is specified, the AxisAddHierarchyAsyncCompleted event does not occur.

member.param: Optional reference to a Control. If specified, the AxisAddHierarchyAsyncCompleted event is raised on the thread on which this control's handle was created. This approach makes it possible to access control members directly from the event handler.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.HasPendingChanges
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether this data source has any changes pending.

remarks.p: When any of the methods which result in a change in the data source are called with a value of false for the 'update' parameter, the change request is cached, but not sent to the OLAP server; this property returns true if any such changes have been made since the last call to the UpdateAsync method.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.PendingChanges
member.summary: Returns a list of changes made to the data source since the last call to the UpdateAsync method.

remarks.p: When any of the methods which result in a change in the data source are called with a value of false for the 'update' parameter, the change request is cached, but not sent to the OLAP server; this property returns a list of these pending changes.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.VerifyCanSetCube
member.summary: When overridden in derived class, provides a way to ensure that the data source supports setting the current data cube.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.Cube
member.summary: Returns the currently selected Cube, or null if no cube is selected.

remarks.p: The current cube can be changed by calling the SetCubeAsync method.
Setting the current cube is an asynchronous operation; as such this property will not return a valid value until the SetCubeAsyncCompleted event has occurred.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.IsInitializing
member.summary: Returns boolean value indicating whether the data source is currently initializing.

remarks.p: This property returns true when the InitializeAsync method has been called, and the OLAP server has not yet sent a response indicating that initialization is complete.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Olap.OlapDataSource.IsAsyncOperationPending
member.summary: Returns boolean value indicating whether the data source is currently processing an asynchronous method call.

remarks.p: This property returns true when an asynchronous method has been called, and the OLAP server has not yet sent a response indicating that the operation is complete.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Olap.InitialSettings
member.summary: Class which exposes properties used to specify the initial settings for the associated data source.

remarks.p: An instance of this class can be passed to the constructor of the OlapDataSource class to establish the initial state of the data source upon initialization.
Once the associated data source has been initialized, none of the property values of this class can be changed; attempting to do so will result in an exception being thrown.

When the InitializeAsync method is called, data is requested from the OLAP server, using the property values from an instance of this class to set the initial cube, as well as the contents of the row, column, and slicer axes.
